boardgame.name: Qin
boardgame.description: In Qin players colonize the Chinese hinterland, seize territories, and expand their influence by placing tiles and pagodas._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A move is simple: You choose one out of three tiles from your hand, place it onto the grid of the board, then draw a new tile. Each tile shows two landscapes. If you create a territory that consists of at least two spaces of the same landscape, you seize it. You can also expand your territories, take over territories from other players, and connect your territories to villages on the board. All of this enables you to place pagodas. The player who is first to get all his pagodas on the board wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
2013 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Winner
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Games 336 - Qin, HomeStretch, and Tea Time
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Qin: Toad and Dragon Turtle Game Boards
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: [Reviews] N°37-B Des ficelles dans la Chine mystique

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: German/English

R_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;R Games (RRG441) Prepare to colonize the Chinese hinterland as you found provinces and absorb remote villages into your growing empire. During your expansion build magnificent pagodas as a sign of your authority. The first to build all his pagodas wins the game. But beware -- the other players can conquer your provinces and villages, tearing down and replacing your pagodas. Plan your expansion wisely, conquer foreign provinces and establish the glorious Qin Dynasty by building your last pagoda! Simple rules make Qin a tactical treat for the whole family. Due to it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s quick playing time and two different game boards, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll want to play again right away.

The game: Eggert/Pegasus (c) 2012. English and German rules included. All game materials are still in mint condition. Shipping: All shipping is done via DHL. Shipping costs depend on size and weight of the parcel and destination. Payment: Within EU I prefer the EU-standard-bank-tranfer (SEPA,IBAN/BIC). It is fast and causes no fees. Outside EU Paypal and bank-transfer are possible.

CLS Games - Atlanta_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Board Game Warehouse - is the largest retailer of board games in metro Atlanta! All games are new _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; still in factory shrink-wrap. Played once. Mint condition. Shipping through USPS from 46628. Should be around $10-$15 shipping.

1. Shipping is from 23113 (Midlothian, VA) and paid by the purchaser. 2. Please geekmail me for shipping quote. I am willing to ship through any major carrier (USPS, FedEx, or UPS). Most people prefer USPS as their shipping costs are much more competitive. That being said, please keep in mind the constrained box sizes of priority/regional-boxes (It may not be possible to package the game super well, which could lead to some box damage in transport). 3. Please allow a few days for the games to be shipped. 4. In general, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m careful about the condition of my games but I am not a collector... I often discard advertisements and inserts. Furthermore, most played games were sleeved during play... but any sleeves will be remove before shipping. If you have any questions about the condition/edition/etc of a game, please don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t hesitate to ask. 5. I reserve the right to cancel purchased based on user’s feedback.
